metadata.recruiting_query: Computer Science students (undergrad or grad) in USA/Canada for part-time remote coding on AI SMS agent project, $30-50/hr - must have public GitHub or portfolio showing at least one completed software project, demonstrate genuine interest in AI/LLMs through projects or contributions, comfortable working with any tech stack and learning new codebases, available for part-time hours remotely

channels.name: LinkedIn CS Students - AI/ML Focus
channels.description: Computer Science students at US/Canadian universities with AI/ML expertise and active GitHub profiles
channels.searchQuery: computer science student AI machine learning GitHub USA Canada

example.name: Phuong Anh Dang (Amy)
example.description: Third-year CS student at University of Toronto with passion for AI, ML, and Data Science. Has active GitHub with projects: github.com/phuonganhdangamy

channels.reason: High-quality leads with verified education, GitHub profiles, and AI/ML focus. LinkedIn shows students actively seeking opportunities.
channels.minability: Direct messaging through LinkedIn, can filter by school, graduation year, and skills

channels.name: LinkedIn CS Students - Full-Stack + AI
channels.description: CS students with full-stack development skills and AI/ML enthusiasm
channels.searchQuery: computer science student full stack AI NLP GitHub

example.name: Ashutosh Jha
example.description: CS student specializing in full-stack development and AI/ML with experience in data science lifecycle and Generative AI solutions. GitHub: github.com/LegendarySlayer

channels.reason: Students with both full-stack skills and AI interest are ideal for adapting to any tech stack. Active project portfolios demonstrate completed work.
channels.minability: LinkedIn allows filtering by university, skills, and 'open to work' status

channels.name: GitHub GenAI Project Contributors
channels.description: Contributors and maintainers of GenAI/LLM project repositories on GitHub

example.name: Ashlesh Khajbage (Ashleshk)
example.description: Maintains GenAI Projects Portfolio with RAG implementations, prompt engineering projects, and LLM applications. Active contributor with completed AI projects.

channels.reason: GitHub contributors show hands-on LLM/AI experience. Can verify coding skills directly through commits and projects.
channels.minability: Review repository contributors, check profiles for student status, reach out via GitHub or linked social profiles

channels.name: GitHub Student Developers with AI Focus
channels.description: Students with AI/ML portfolios and active GitHub presence

example.name: Supratik Banerjee (supratikb23)
example.description: Undergrad CS student specializing in AI/ML at IEM Kolkata. Built Deep Learning models for Epileptic Seizure Detection using CNN-BiLSTM. Active in open-source. Portfolio shows completed projects.

channels.reason: Portfolio sites demonstrate completed projects and technical writing skills. Can verify project quality directly.
channels.minability: Search GitHub for student portfolios with AI projects, contact through GitHub profile or portfolio contact form

channels.name: Indie Hackers - Student AI Builders
channels.description: Student indie hackers who built and shipped AI/LLM products
channels.searchQuery: student OR college AI chatbot LLM

example.name: Yasser Elsaid
example.description: Built Chatbase (AI chatbot builder) as a 4th year CS student at York University (Canada). GitHub shows coding ability. Twitter: @yasser_elsaid_

channels.reason: Indie Hackers members have shipped real products, demonstrating both technical skills and initiative. Strong signal for self-motivated builders.
channels.minability: Search Indie Hackers posts for student builders, reach out via platform messaging or linked social profiles

channels.name: University AI Course Projects
channels.description: Students from top CS programs with AI/LLM course project repositories
channels.searchQuery: stanford-cs OR mit-csail OR cmu-cs AI LLM project

example.name: Stanford CS 224G Students
example.description: Students from CS 224G (Apps with LLMs Inside) build prototype LLM applications. Course emphasizes hands-on project work with 2-week sprint cadence.

channels.reason: Top university courses produce students with strong fundamentals and completed AI/LLM projects. Projects are often on GitHub.
channels.minability: Review course websites for student project showcases, find students on LinkedIn or GitHub from these courses

channels.name: Dev.to / Hashnode - AI/LLM Student Bloggers
channels.description: Students writing technical blogs about their AI/LLM projects and learning journey

example.name: Hashnode #llm Community
example.description: 271 followers, 1.8K articles. Students document building chatbots, LLM applications, and local AI projects. Many link to GitHub repos in blog posts.

channels.reason: Technical bloggers demonstrate communication skills and deep understanding. Blog posts often link to GitHub projects for verification.
channels.minability: Search by #llm, #ai, #student tags. Contact authors through blog platform or linked social profiles

channels.name: CMU Research Projects - AI/LLM
channels.description: CMU students working on LLM/AI research projects with public code repositories
channels.searchQuery: CMU HCII OR CMU MLD LLM research GitHub

example.name: Christina Ma (CMU HCII PhD)
example.description: PhD student at CMU HCII working on Requirement-Oriented Prompt Engineering (ROPE). Open-sourced training tools. Email: qianoum@andrew.cmu.edu

channels.reason: Research students have deep AI/LLM knowledge but may prefer research roles. Good for advanced part-time opportunities.
channels.minability: Review university research lab pages, find students via lab websites or publications, contact through academic email

notes: Web search limitations: Some site-specific searches (site:twitter.com, site:github.com) were not supported, limiting ability to find direct Twitter profiles
Focus on verified examples: Each channel includes a real person or community with verifiable URLs
LinkedIn emerged as strongest channel with multiple high-quality verified examples
GitHub repositories and portfolios provide direct code verification
Community platforms (Indie Hackers, Hashnode) show students who ship real projects
University course projects provide access to students with structured AI/LLM learning
recommended_approach: Start with LinkedIn searches filtering for CS students at target universities with AI/ML skills and GitHub profiles
Review GitHub repositories in AI/LLM topics to find active student contributors
Post on Indie Hackers and similar communities targeting student builders
Monitor university AI course websites for student project showcases
Engage with technical bloggers on Hashnode/Dev.to who write about AI/LLM projects
